channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'We're in a holding pattern': Home sales and building slump in the face of uncertainty
item.description: Would-be homebuyers are finding lots of reasons to wait.

item.title: Change to COVID vaccine guidance. And, dozens hurt in new Gaza aid distribution
item.description: The federal government's latest guidance for COVID-19 vaccines is raising concerns among some independent experts. And, dozens of Palestinians hurt du...

item.title: In a county that backed Trump, people depend on Medicaid and are conflicted about cuts
item.description: Medicaid plays a vital role in many rural communities that favored President Trump in the 2024 election. But residents still seem open to Republican p...

item.title: Word of the Week: How 'pride' shifted from vice to a symbol of LGBTQ empowerment
item.description: The word pride has shifted over the millennia, from being first used to describe one of the seven deadly sins in Roman Catholic theology to becoming a...

item.title: Trump is pardoning Todd and Julie Chrisley, the reality TV couple convicted of fraud
item.description: Todd and Julie Chrisley, who rose to fame in a reality show highlighting their lavish lifestyle, had been serving yearslong prison sentences after 202...

item.title: EU says Israeli strikes in Gaza 'go beyond what is necessary' to fight Hamas
item.description: Kaja Kallas, the EU's top diplomat, says the bloc also does not support a new aid distribution model which bypasses the UN and other humanitarian orga...

item.title: Spelling bee spotlight sparks debate over English's quirks
item.description: Author Gabe Henry's new book "Enough is ENUF" makes the case that English spelling is more confusing than it needs to be.

item.title: "Survivor" cast includes "The White Lotus" creator Mike White for 50th season
item.description: "CBS Mornings" exclusively reveals the cast for the 50th season of "Survivor" featuring fan favorites as returning players.

item.title: Kenyan president apologises to Tanzania over deportation row
item.description: It follows growing criticism from Kenyans targeting Tanzania's president over the recent deportation of activists.

item.title: GameStop purchases $500 million in bitcoin in first crypto push
item.description: GameStop, an ailing video game retailer and "meme stock," is pushing into the cryptocurrency sector.

item.title: After a 15-year battle, Harvard agrees in settlement to relinquish early photos of slaves
item.description: Harvard University will relinquish 175-year-old photographs believed to be the earliest taken of enslaved people.

item.title: German chancellor promises to help Ukraine produce long-range missiles
item.description: Friedrich Merz said earlier there were "no longer" any range restrictions on weapons supplied by Kyiv's Western allies.

item.title: Namibia marks colonial genocide for first time with memorial day
item.description: Concentration camps and pseudoscientific experiments were used by German officials to torture and kill.

item.title: Here's the top predictor of financial well-being, researchers say
item.description: It doesn't take $1 million to secure a sense of financial well-being, according to new research from Vanguard.

item.title: Lizzy McAlpine talks Broadway debut and TikTok success
item.description: Platinum-selling artist Lizzy McAlpine sits down with Anthony Mason to discuss her viral song "Spring Into Summer," her path to pop stardom and her lo...

item.title: Israel PM says Hamas's Gaza chief Mohammed Sinwar has been killed
item.description: Mohammed Sinwar was the target of a Israeli strike on the courtyard of the European hospital in Khan Younis on 13 May.

item.title: New Orleans jail escapees caught following car chase in Texas; 2 inmates still on the run
Manhunt launched for ex-police chief known as ‘Devil in the Ozarks’ after his escape from prison
